Summary: Biochemical reaction from phenytoin catechol to phenytoin quinone. This interaction is catalyzed by NQO1.
Biochemical reaction from phenytoin quinone to protein adduct. This interaction can be catalyzed by CYPs, TBXAS1 or PTGIS.
Biochemical reaction from hydroxyphenytoin to hydroxyphenytoin glucuronide. This interaction can be catalyzed by UGT1A1, UGT2B15, UGT1A4, UGT1A6 or UGT1A9.
Biochemical reaction from fosphenytoin to phenytoin. This interaction is catalyzed by ALPL.
Biochemical reaction from phenytoin arene-oxide to hydroxyphenytoin.
Biochemical reaction from phenytoin catechol to phenytoin methylcatechol. This interaction is catalyzed by COMT.

Controller: CYP1A2, CYP2A6, CYP2C19, CYP2C8, CYP2C9, CYP2D6, CYP2E1, EPHX1
Summary: Biochemical reaction from phenytoin arene-oxide to phenytoin dihydrodiol. This interaction can be catalyzed by CYP2A6, CYP2C9, CYP2E1, CYP1A2, EPHX1, CYP2C8, CYP2D6 or CYP2C19.
Biochemical reaction from phenytoin dihydrodiol to phenytoin catechol.
Biochemical reaction from phenytoin to phenytoin arene-oxide. This interaction can be catalyzed by CYP2C9 or CYP2C19.
Biochemical reaction from hydroxyphenytoin to phenytoin catechol. This interaction can be catalyzed by CYP3A4, CYP2C9, CYP2C19, CYP3A7 or CYP3A5.
